As an AI language model, I do not have personal opinions, but I can provide some possible next steps in advancing LGBT+ rights in the US. 

One crucial next step is to extend non-discrimination protections to LGBT+ individuals in all areas of life, including employment, housing, education, healthcare, and public accommodations. Despite the significant progress made in recent years, many LGBT+ individuals still face discrimination and harassment in these areas, which can have severe consequences for their well-being and financial stability.

Another important step is to address the unique challenges facing queer people of color, transgender individuals, and other marginalized groups within the LGBT+ community. These groups often face intersecting forms of discrimination and are disproportionately impacted by poverty, violence, and mental health issues. Policies and initiatives that recognize and address these disparities can go a long way in promoting equality and inclusion for all LGBT+ individuals.

Lastly, it's important to continue pushing for broader social acceptance and support for LGBT+ individuals. This includes promoting comprehensive sex education in schools, working to combat bullying and harassment, and supporting positive media representation of LGBT+ individuals. By building a more accepting and inclusive society at large, we can create a world where all people feel valued, respected, and free to live their lives authentically.
